comment._content: Sewell survived the war as per the LG: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/32566/supplements/123

comment.author: 69655568@N05
comment._content: Glad you made it back, hopping you had a good life.

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11953092@N04] Thank you for the link, we really appreciate it. This is exactly what we hoped people might do, so we are very grateful. We are going to be announcing a major project seeking everyone's help to uncover the life stories of those who served in the First World War. Watch out for announcements on: Our website www.1914.org Our Facebook page Our Twitter account Thank you again.

comment.author: 11953092@N04
comment._content: From his Medal Index Card. His full name is Ralph Houghton Sewell. Quite a late entrant into France he landed 2/2/1918. When applied for his medals he was living in Ingatestone in Essex. From the LG he was a Sandhurst graduate of July 1917: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30164/supplements/6667/pa... From the register of births he was born in late 1897 making him 21 during his war service

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: 19th (Queen Alexandra's Own Royal) Hussars, 9th Cavalry Brigade, 1st Cavalry Division; the Brigade provided squadrons of dismounted troops for trench holding duties, notably C Squadron near St Quentin on 22nd March 1918 confronting the German offensive when they counter-attacked in an attempt to retake Hervilly Wood.  The 19th Hussars again saw mounted action in 1918 at the Battle of Amiens (supporting Canadian infantry) and during the pursuit of the German Army to Mons (which included a disastrous cavalry charge against infantry in the open on 8th October 1918).//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
His father was a Brewer who died in 1953 at the age of 90. Ralph is mentioned in the National Probate records so presumably was still alive at that point. He is described as a Company Director, presumably of the family brewing business? Also mentioned are Olive Julia Houghton Charrington singlewoman and William Owen Campbell Sewell, also a Company Director. His estate was valued at £113614 1s 6d.

Barbara Helen Sewell (nee Lawrence) died as recently as 2004 in the registration district of Hammersmith & Fulham, London. Born 2 Sep 1912 in Romford, Essex.
